title: 107_s2449
content: The Act titled "Federal Responsibility for Immigrant Health Act of 2002" allows federal payments under Medicaid for emergency medical conditions of certain aliens. The Act allows Medicaid payments for emergency medical conditions of certain aliens, including necessary care and services for emergency medical conditions, pregnancy-related services, and testing or treatment for communicable diseases. States have the option to eliminate residency requirements for aliens granted parole or admitted as nonimmigrant aliens. The Act allows Medicaid payments for emergency medical conditions of certain aliens, including necessary care and services for emergency medical conditions, pregnancy-related services, and testing or treatment for communicable diseases. States have the option to eliminate residency requirements for aliens granted parole or admitted as nonimmigrant aliens. The amendment in section 1396b(v)(2)(B) allows for the inclusion of residency requirements under the State plan for aliens granted parole or admitted as nonimmigrant aliens. The effective date for these amendments is upon the enactment of the Act. SEC. 3. Funding for emergency health services for undocumented aliens. Funding for emergency health services for undocumented aliens is allocated as follows: $25,000,000 for each fiscal year from 1998 to 2001, and $50,000,000 for each fiscal year from 2003 to 2007. The Secretary of Health and Human Services determines allotments for the 15 states with the highest percentage of undocumented aliens for fiscal years 2003 to 2007. The Secretary of Health and Human Services calculates allotments for the 15 states with the highest percentage of undocumented aliens for fiscal years 2003 to 2007 based on the ratio of undocumented aliens in each state. Any unspent allotment in a fiscal year can be used in the following year. The percentage of undocumented aliens in a State is determined based on the most recent estimates by the Statistics Division of the Immigration and Naturalization Service. Funds are required to assist hospitals and providers of emergency health services to undocumented aliens, with payments made to eligible facilities in accordance with State plans submitted to the Secretary. Payments will be allocated to hospitals and providers of emergency health services for undocumented aliens in areas impacted by health costs related to undocumented aliens. Payments will be based on each facility's payments for emergency medical services under the State plan or an alternative proxy for measuring services provided to undocumented aliens. Definitions and special rules apply for this subsection. The subsection defines eligible hospitals and related providers for services provided to undocumented aliens, with special rules and definitions for hospitals, providers, and payment limitations. The subsection outlines restrictions on using federal payments for emergency medical services under title XIX of the Social Security Act, effective starting fiscal year 2003.
